titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ هِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَرَامٌ
titles.en: Chapter 58 – The man is saying to his wife that she is prohibited unto him

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ هِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَرَامٌ
titles.en: Chapter 58 – The man is saying to his wife that she is prohibited unto him

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَقَالَ لِي لَوْ كَانَ لِي عَلَيْهِ سُلْطَانٌ لَأَوْجَعْتُ رَأْسَهُ وَ قُلْتُ لَهُ اللَّهُ أَحَلَّهَا لَكَ فَمَا حَرَّمَهَا عَلَيْكَ إِنَّهُ لَمْ يَزِدْ عَلَى أَنْ كَذَبَ فَزَعَمَ أَنَّ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَهُ حَرَامٌ وَ لَا يَدْخُلُ عَلَيْهِ طَلَاقٌ وَ لَا كَفَّارَةٌ فَقُلْتُ قَوْلُ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ ما أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ فَجَعَلَ فِيهِ الْكَفَّارَةَ فَقَالَ إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْهِ جَارِيَتَهُ مَارِيَةَ وَ حَلَفَ أَنْ لَا يَقْرَبَهَا فَإِنَّمَا جَعَلَ عَلَيْهِ الْكَفَّارَةَ فِي الْحَلْفِ وَ لَمْ يَجْعَلْ عَلَيْهِ فِي التَّحْرِيمِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Abu Nasr, from Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from Zurara, (It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws, said, ‘I asked himasws about a man who says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’. So heasws said to me: ‘If there was authority for measws upon him, Iasws would have pained his head, and said to him: ‘Allahazwj has Made her Permissible for you, so what is prohibiting her unto you?’ It does not increase upon a lie if he claims that whatever Allahazwj has Permitted for him is prohibited, and a divorce does not enter upon him, nor an expiation’. So I said, ‘(What about) the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [66:1] O Prophet! Do not deny (yourself) that which Allah has made lawful for you, so Heazwj Made the expiation to be with regards to it?’ So heasws said: ‘But rather hesaww forbid unto himself a slave girls Mariah (the Coptic), and swore that hesaww would not go near her. But rather the expiation was Made to be upon himsaww regarding the swear, and was not Made upon himsaww for the prohibition’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَإِنَّا نُرْوَى بِالْعِرَاقِ أَنَّ عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) جَعَلَهَا ثَلَاثاً فَقَالَ كَذَبُوا لَمْ يَجْعَلْهَا طَلَاقاً وَ لَوْ كَانَ لِي عَلَيْهِ سُلْطَانٌ لَأَوْجَعْتُ رَأْسَهُ ثُمَّ أَقُولُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَحَلَّهَا لَكَ فَمَا ذَا حَرَّمَهَا عَلَيْكَ مَا زِدْتَ عَلَى أَنْ كَذَبْتَ فَقُلْتَ لِشَيْ‏ءٍ أَحَلَّهُ اللَّهُ لَكَ إِنَّهُ حَرَامٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Umar Bin Azina, from Zurara, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What are you<sup>asws</sup> saying regarding a man who says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’, for we are reporting at Al-Iraq that Ali<sup>asws</sup> made it to be as three (divorces)?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They are lying! He<sup>asws</sup> did not make it to be as a divorce, and if there was an authority for me<sup>asws</sup> over him, I<sup>asws</sup> would pain his head, then I<sup>asws</sup> would be saying that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has Made her to be Permissible for you, so what is that which prohibits her unto you? It would not be any more a life if you were to say for something which Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Permitted it for you, that it is prohibited’.

verses.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنِ ابْنِ رِبَاطٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَخْلَدٍ السَّرَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ لِي شَبَّةُ بْنُ عَقَّالٍ بَلَغَنِي أَنَّكَ تَزْعُمُ أَنَّ مَنْ قَالَ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ أَنَّكَ لَا تَرَى ذَلِكَ شَيْئاً قُلْتُ أَمَّا قَوْلُكَ الْحِلُّ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَهَذَا أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ الْوَلِيدُ جَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فِي أَمْرِ سَلَامَةَ امْرَأَتِهِ وَ أَنَّهُ بَعَثَ يَسْتَفْتِي أَهْلَ الْحِجَازِ وَ أَهْلَ الْعِرَاقِ وَ أَهْلَ الشَّامِ فَاخْتَلَفُوا عَلَيْهِ فَأَخَذَ بِقَوْلِ أَهْلِ الْحِجَازِ إِنَّ ذَلِكَ لَيْسَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, from Ibn Rabat, from Abu Makhlad, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Shabbat Bin Aqqal said to me<sup>asws</sup>, ‘It has reached me that you<sup>asws</sup> are claiming that the one who says, ‘what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Permitted upon me is prohibited’, that you<sup>asws</sup> do not see that as anything?’ I<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘As for your words, ‘I have permitted upon me a prohibition’, so this is what Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> made that in the matter of Salama of his wife, and he had sent for a verdict to the people of Al-Hijaz, and the people of Al-Iraq, and people of Syria, so they differed over it. So he took to by the words of the people of Al-Hijaz that, that is not with anything’.

verses.text: حُمَيْدٌ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) رَجُلٌ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ كَفَّارَةٌ وَ لَا طَلَاقٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd, from Ibn Sama’at, from Safwan, from Hareyz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A man says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no expiation upon him, nor a divorce’.
